intro: Tissa villosa, commonly known as the hairy tissa, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Tissa villosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological studies of tropical flora.
